Prey: Insects, small mammals, reptiles, amphibians, spiders, eggs
Fun Fact: A group of ravens is called an unkindness or a conspiracy.
Other Name(s): Corby, corbeau, western raven, northern raven
Habitat: Open areas such as tundras, taigas, cliffs, deserts, plains, but can be found in just about every habitat save rainforests
Predators: Owls, eagles, martens attack their eggs, larger birds of prey such as great horned owls and mammalian carnivores such as coyotes or cougars might prey on younger ravens.
Location: Most countries in the northern hemisphere, including most of North America, southern Greenland, north Africa, most of Europe, Russia and China
Nesting Location: Old trees, ledges, cliffs, even utility poles
Name: Common Raven
